title: ISING_MODEL: math ↔ q-bio
mathematical_structure: H = -J Σ σi σj - h Σ σi
explanation: Both papers study binary state systems with nearest-neighbor interactions. The math paper applies this to math systems, while the q-bio paper uses the identical mathematical framework for q-bio applications. Despite the different domains, the underlying mathematics (H = -J Σ σi σj - h Σ σi) is isomorphic.

paper_1.title: Excursion decomposition of the XOR-Ising model

paper_2.title: In vitro binding energies capture Klf4 occupancy across the human genome

title: Diffusion Models (AI) ↔ MRI Diffusion (Medicine)
explanation: Both AI diffusion models for image generation and MRI diffusion imaging follow the same heat equation. The mathematical structure ∂u/∂t = k∇²u describes how information (AI) or water molecules (MRI) diffuse through space over time.

paper_1.title: Causality in Video Diffusers is Separable from Denoising

paper_2.title: Open diffusion MRI and connectivity data for epilepsy and surgery

title: POWER_LAW: physics ↔ q-fin
explanation: Both papers study power law distributions P(x) ∝ x^(-α). The physics paper applies this to physics systems showing scale-free behavior, while the q-fin paper finds the same mathematical structure in q-fin phenomena. Despite different domains, both follow identical power law scaling.

paper_1.title: Compressing Complexity: A Critical Synthesis of Structural, Analytical, and Data-Driven Dimensionality Reduction in Dynamical Networks

paper_2.title: A unified theory of order flow, market impact, and volatility

title: POWER_LAW: physics ↔ nlin
explanation: Both papers study power law distributions P(x) ∝ x^(-α). The physics paper applies this to physics systems showing scale-free behavior, while the nlin paper finds the same mathematical structure in nlin phenomena. Despite different domains, both follow identical power law scaling.

paper_1.title: Compressing Complexity: A Critical Synthesis of Structural, Analytical, and Data-Driven Dimensionality Reduction in Dynamical Networks

paper_2.title: Pattern Formation in Excitable Neuronal Maps

title: POWER_LAW: cond-mat ↔ q-fin
explanation: Both papers study power law distributions P(x) ∝ x^(-α). The cond-mat paper applies this to cond-mat systems showing scale-free behavior, while the q-fin paper finds the same mathematical structure in q-fin phenomena. Despite different domains, both follow identical power law scaling.

paper_1.title: Broken neural scaling laws in materials science

paper_2.title: A unified theory of order flow, market impact, and volatility

title: Robot Task Segmentation ↔ Sleep Stage Dynamics
explanation: Robot task segmentation and sleep stage transitions both follow Lotka-Volterra dynamics. The coupled nonlinear ODEs dx/dt = ax - bxy, dy/dt = -cy + dxy describe competing states (task modes or sleep stages) with mutual inhibition.

paper_1.title: RoboSubtaskNet: Temporal Sub-task Segmentation for Human-to-Robot Skill Transfer
